Articles.Content:
for those interested about Apollo 11's mission here is a report and a poster of the mission

https://sites.google.com/site/yoctocosmos/poster_high.jpg

http://www.hq.nasa.gov/alsj/a11/A11_MissionOpReport.pdf

and of all that is just too technical there is always XKCD's description of the craft;

image from XKCD 1133

My favourite xkcd comic. I think there should be a decree that all science papers should be written twice, once in normal jargon, and once like this

"If you can't explain an idea simply, you don't understand it well enough"
wow! 90% of the Apollo 11 was to get out of the atmosphere

I just realized my apollo replica looks wrong....

I've been doing it with 2.5 m and 3.75m parts, looks like I need 5m parts for the first 2 stages.

I'm rather ashamed that this is a sudden realization because I've looked at the XKCD image tons of times.

I just realized my apollo replica looks wrong....

I've been doing it with 2.5 m and 3.75m parts, looks like I need 5m parts for the first 2 stages.

I'm rather ashamed that this is a sudden realization because I've looked at the XKCD image tons of times.

Is there a mod that adds 5m parts? I mean to make an Apollo replica as well, but it is easiest with 5m parts.

Is there a mod that adds 5m parts? I mean to make an Apollo replica as well, but it is easiest with 5m parts.

NovaPunch has 5-metre parts. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/novapunch-remix-pack/
OMG thank you i love things like this

NovaPunch has 5-metre parts. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/novapunch-remix-pack/

Thank you!

Thank you!

Glad I could help out, mate! Happy flying!

Robert Heinlein. "Once you're in orbit, you're halfway to anywhere."
Shame I can't read the txt on those images.. What did they do with the Lem after the crew exits it for the return home burn? They just jettison it? So is the Lem still orbiting the moon?
Click on the image once it is loaded, and your browser should zoom to a full size view.
wow, that poster is incredibly more HD then the one i had previously saved, thanks!

Ah right ill try to remember that one

thanks

Shame I can't read the txt on those images.. What did they do with the Lem after the crew exits it for the return home burn? They just jettison it? So is the Lem still orbiting the moon?

Depends on what mission you're looking at. Most dumped the LEM in lunar orbit. Sometimes they bothered to deorbit it, sometimes they just left it to decay on its own (lunar orbits are notoriously unstable). The only exceptions to this are the early test missions and Apollo 13 where they used it as lifeboat. In both cases it burned up in the atmosphere. A notable exception is Apollo 10, the ascent stage ended up in solar orbit in that mission.
